content.description: The obvious crack systems and jug rails on the far right of the Beneathaverse. From a juggy sidepull and right hand undercling, climb up, trending slightly left. While the rock is somewhat ugly at first glance, the rock is extremely good quality.
content.location: The far right side of the Beneathaverse slabs, between two far more blank looking sections.

content.description: Sit start from a left undercling and right hand in the bottom of either vertical crack. Climb direct. While the difficulty significantly eases after the first couple moves, the moves remain non-trivial until about 15 feet off the deck. From here, the climbing turns into easy 5.5 climbing for another 10+ feet.
content.location: Directly left of the gnarled tree and main cave section of the Beneathaverse.

climbs.name: Chunk Mump and the Crump Stump

content.description: Stand start left hand in crack, right on flake.  Work your way up until you hit 1/3ish pad sharp crimp on the face.  Work your feet up, bump right to pretty decent crimp up higher.  Trust your left and stand up on it so you can hit the good sloper with the left, then work your way through the topout.  You can either work left into the top of Savoir Faire or go direct.
content.protection: A couple pads.  Spotter to make sure you don't end up on the tree is always nice
content.location: Just to the right of Savoir Faire.  Look for the beautiful left leaning crack right behind a small tree.

content.description: From a sit start with at least one hand in the bottom of the crack, trend up and slightly left along the prowlike feature. Slick and scrunchy feet make this climb much harder than it initially looks.
content.location: Left side of the Beneathaverse. Approximately 20 feet right of the dihedral and 15 feet left of Manic Pixie Dream Lion.

content.description: One of the coolest formations in Eastern MO, the Beneathaverse is a single 100+ foot cliffband featuring roof, vert, slab, compression and even dihedral climbing.
